Array: Luck be with you...
Nari! Chihaya! Where are you?!
Say something! Please!
Naaaariiii!! Chihaaaayaaaa!!
...Eep!
That's enough, now, you guys...
(Where in the world could they have gone...?)
After separating from the kindly blue spirit, we'd
continued wandering the halls of this ruined school,
and had been at it for what seemed like an eternity.
We kept hoping we'd find some trace of Naruse,
Kazane or Hikari, but that seemed increasingly
unlikely with each passing moment.
No matter how much ground we covered or how loudly
we called out for them, there was just...nothing.
Our anxiety and irritation was growing, and we
were becoming completely exhausted.
And Nari and Chihaya just kept fighting! This was
pretty normal for them, and they always made up
quickly enough, so I wasn't too worried at first...
...but this time was different. Our circumstances
were far from normal...
*pant* *pant*
*pant*
*whimper* I don't want to do this anymore.
I'm tired...
We can't just stop here, Chihaya. That ghost from
before is probably still on our tail. Let's just go
a little farther, okay? Then we can take a breather.
But Naaana, I can't run anymore...
God, Chihaya.
All you know how to say is 'I'm tired,' and
'I can't run anymore.' Give it a rest, already!
If I were in your shoes, I'd be tired just from
telling us how tired you are every few minutes.
Just suck it up and keep running!
Y-You're mean, Nari! You don't understand!
Don't understand what? That you're a spineless
coward?!
You are too! You're just pretending to be strong
so you can make me look bad. But you're just as
scared and tired as we are!
The hell are you talking about?!
Come on, you two. This isn't helping anything.
But she keeps antagonizing me! She's being mean
to me for no reason!
Ugh.
Don't start pointing fingers if you're not prepared
to have a few pointed right back at you.
I wouldn't be so angry in the first place if you
weren't so damned irritating!
But we're running in circles! We must've covered
this hallway a hundred times already. I'm really
tired!
And...I mean, just being in a place like this
is enough to put anyone on edge. You can't blame
me for being scared!
You're scared too! Admit it!
And just who the hell do you think you are,
telling me how I feel?!
Wh-Why don't you both just take a deep breath and
try to calm down, okay?
No. I've had it. I'm not budging another inch
until I've had a chance to rest.
Chihaya...
Hmph. Guess you wouldn't mind us leaving you behind,
then. See how you like being all by yourself when
the ghosts come by. That'd serve you right!
What? No!
Why not?!
Your legs hurt, don't they? And you're just MUCH
too tired to go on. So I think that's just what we
should do. We should leave you here all alone!
NO!!
Stop it! Both of you!
This is no time to be fighting amongst ourselves!
Look, there's at least one malevolent ghost in here,
chasing us down, and it's probably almost caught up
with us by now. We need to find a place to hide.
*sigh*
Come on, Nana. Let's just go.
Huh? W-Wait, Nari...!
...Chihaya, you wait here, okay? I'll go talk some
sense into Nari and bring her back. In the meantime,
just try to find some cover, I guess.
...*sniffle*...
Wait! Nari, hold up already!
Nari...
Let's go back, okay? We really shouldn't leave
Chihaya by herself. You know that.
I don't care anymore.
What...?
I said I don't give a shit what happens to Chihaya
anymore!
Nari...
All she ever does is whine, whine, whine and cause
nothing but trouble for everyone around her.
You included.
She acts like she's such a good girl, but when she
doesn't get her way, she turns into a raging bitch.
I just never realized how much of one until now.
Nari!
I've never heard you speak that way before.
I don't want you two to fight like this. We've been
so good about working together to find Naruse and
the others this whole time...
If we allow ourselves to get split up now due to
this petty bickering, it's entirely possible you'll
never see Chihaya again, you know.
Is that what you want?
Come on. Let's go back. Even you have to realize
you went a little too far this time, right?
And it's not like Chihaya was trying to pick a fight
with you or anything.
She was just scared! Really, really scared.
And can you blame her? We're trapped in here,
and have no idea what lies ahead for us.
But it's at times like this especially that we
absolutely have to stick together. If we allow
ourselves to get split up, we're done!
...Nana...
You really are a strong person, you know.
I could never think the way you think. I just don't
have it in me.
...All right. Let's go back. It'd be really bad if
she got caught by that ghost.
Way to go, Nari! I'm right behind you!
What's wrong, Nana?
My student ID just fell between the floorboards.
I've gotta fish it out. You go on ahead, okay?
What? But, I...
I'll only be a minute! I just don't want Chihaya to
be alone any longer than she has to be. Go!
Well, if you say so. Just...don't take too long,
okay?
I won't.
*sigh* Of all the things to happen! At least it got
caught partway and didn't fall into oblivion. Thank
goodness for small favors, I guess!
Peering through a gap in the floorboards, I caught
sight of my ID resting on a support beam, but
I could only fit my hand in there up to the wrist.
If I don't do this just right, I'm going to knock
it off and it'll fall down to...who knows where.
With a bit of finagling, I was able to get just
far enough in to touch the cover of the booklet
with my pointer finger.
Rnnng... Just a...little bit...farther...
...Almost...got it...
...There we go! Man, that was a close one.
I'd better hurry back!
...Huh? Nari? Chihaya?
Where'd you two go?
Naaaaariiii!!
Chihaaaaaayaaaaa!!
...It's not like I was gone for that long, was I?
That couldn't have even been two minutes!
Not even two minutes...
...but that's all it took, huh? All it took for
circumstances to turn sour on me.
I'm all alone now, aren't I? No more Nari or
Chihaya to lean on...
Kya ha ha! It's their fault for believing!
We're gonna take down the head that vomits from
the ceiling, nice and slow...
Believing is beautiful. Ba-dum-ba-dum-ba-dum-ba-dum
ba-dum... The hearts roll along the ground, all the
while smiling alongside their tooth marks.
(What the hell does that even mean?!)
Is believing a sin? Or is the sin when one does not
believe? Perhaps only time can reveal the truth.
(I don't like these guys one bit. I need to get
up to the third floor right away!)
(There are still red spirits here?! But...there are
no other routes I can take. I guess I'll just have
to...sneak past it...?)
Finally, you're all by yourself. Being by yourself
is scary. Being by yourself is painful. And dying
by yourself is...
The door won't budge even the slightest bit.
It might as well be a brick wall.
The door won't budge even the slightest bit.
It might as well be a brick wall.
The door won't budge even the slightest bit.
It might as well be a brick wall.
The door won't budge even the slightest bit.
It might as well be a brick wall.
The door won't budge even the slightest bit.
It might as well be a brick wall.
The door won't budge even the slightest bit.
It might as well be a brick wall.
The door won't budge even the slightest bit.
It might as well be a brick wall.
(Gah! Here, too?!)
Are you still searching?
Chaos and despair, order and cleanliness...
They must each be squirreled away somewhere.
Look! Over there! And there! And even over there!
It's nothing but nail marks from people who've
withered away! Hahahahahahahaha!
Stop! Keep away from me!
Hahahahaha... Hahahahaha!
Nnnng...
(The boys' room again. Is that blue spirit still
here, I wonder?)
He was in...the last stall, right?
...Ummmm...
(No answer. I wonder where he went. Maybe I should
try opening it...)
SHUT THE GODDAMNED DOOR!!
Eek!
(Th-That scared the crap out of me. But that voice
is totally unmistakable.)
*exhale*
...Okay!
Ummm, Mr. Blue Spirit? It's me. I helped track down
your missing hat and glasses earlier.
I was wondering who had come to disturb my
reverie!
Oh, good. You are still here.
But of course! I'm bound to this spot, after all.
I couldn't separate myself from it even if I tried.
W-Wow, okay. Well, either way, I'm glad to see you
again, Mr. Blue Spirit.
..? Mr. Blue Spirit?
I have but one more humble request of you.
...co jest...?
Would you please stop referring to me as
'Mr. Blue Spirit'?
But, I...don't know your actual name, Mr. Blue
Spirit.
Oh! Oh, dear me! Where are my manners?
And in the presence of a lady, no less!
...Ahem! Please, do excuse my rudeness.
Allow me to properly introduce myself.
My name is Shimoda. Souichiro Shimoda.
In life, I was the head of an old noble family.
My estate stood on these very grounds, in fact,
long before the construction of Heavenly Host
Elementary.
So you're...nobility?
That is the long and the short of it, yes.
My family once put great stock in our lineage...
though I personally, not as much.
I cannot deny the attachment I have to these
grounds, however. It has become quite impossible
for me to separate myself from them.
...But, enough about me!
Might I inquire as to your name?
I'm Nana Ogasawara, a seventh-grader at Musashigawa
Girls' Middle School.
Nana Ogasawara... A fine name. And what of the
two others who were with you previously?
Uh... We got separated along the way, unfortunately.
I've been searching everywhere for them, but...
I haven't had any luck.
Hmmm... That is quite unfortunate indeed.
Other victims have passed through this lavatory,
and as I understand from their laments, a peculiar
phenomenon plays out within these cursed halls.
Their friends can oft be heard...but not seen.
And when passing through a hallway after having been
down it mere minutes before, bodies therein will
have become bleached bones as if years had passed.
Perhaps a similar phenomenon has occurred between
you and your companions.
So are you saying...I'm alone in here now? And I'll
never be able to see Nari or Chihaya again?!
That is a possibility, yes. I cannot confirm it,
but I also cannot deny that this does occur, and
is a very real threat.
No. That can't be. I'll bet the people you heard
that from were just...getting confused. Or even
just making it up altogether!
...I'm afraid--
Why? I was only separated from them for a minute!
How could that possibly lead to this?!
Come on, Mr. Shimoda. Please tell me you're just
joking with me. Tell me everything will be all
right. Come on! Please, Mr. Shimoda!
I'm sorry. I cannot refute this possibility.
...Rrrnnng...ggggh...
...Ghhhwaaaaaahaaaaah...!
...No... No! NO!!
*sob*
Nana...
*hic* I don't want to be...alone...
Not in here...
I don't want to die alone!
*sniffle* *whimper*
...Mom... Dad... Yuusei...!
Why did they all have to leave me?
Why isn't anyone here by my side?!
Ngggh... Nari... Chihaya... Somebody, please, come
save me! Save me from all this! *sob*
I'm...not strong. Not at all. Not...at all...
*whimper*
No one is, Nana. No matter how hard one's heart may
be, there will always be a considerable soft spot
upon it.
But...*sob*...my friends are all...*sob*...
Do not be embarrassed to show your true feelings.
Let the tears stream down your cheeks. Cry till
you can cry no more. Let it all out!
*sob* *sob*
*whine* *bawl*
I'm so lonely...and scared...
...I don't want to die...
Do you feel better now?
*sniffle* ...Yes.
You've been holding that in for a while, I surmise.
A pitiable fate for one so young...
I...have a crybaby little brother named Yuusei.
And my mom would always tell me that since I'm the
older sibling, I have to be strong.
So I kind of...swallow my true feelings as a force
of habit these days.
I try to always keep it together, and always keep
whatever I'm worried about inside me. But here...
...I think Nari understood that. I think she saw
through me. And she was trying to look out for me.
It's funny how alike she and Chihaya are in that
regard. They both know me too well for their own
good. I can't fool either one of them.
They're actually a lot more alike than they'd care
to admit, in fact. They're both so blunt, and so
unaware of how they come across to other people...
*sigh* ...I feel a lot better now, Mr. Shimoda.
Now that I've bawled my eyes out. Thank you.
Think nothing of it.
Um, Mr. Shimoda, did you...ever fall in love, back
when you were alive?
Hmm? What an odd change of topic.
It's just something I've been wondering about.
I want to know what kind of person you were in life.
...I did. There was a woman named Aya for whom
I cared quite deeply. A remarkable woman, very prim
and proper and simply aglow with intelligence.
I met her through a mutual friend of ours, and it
was love at first sight.
With her by my side, I could bear the end of the
world itself and not bat an eye.
But the era in which I lived...was a tumultuous one.
A time in which the world belonged to the West, and
those of nobility were forced to adapt or die.
Many men clung to their firm beliefs in the new
ways, and with iron resolve, they would set sail
across the ocean for new opportunities.
I...was one of those men.
Ordinarily, I would never deign to leave my love,
who suffered from a weak constitution, alone and
unattended. But by her own urgings, off I went.
You mean, she insisted you go? That's pretty
amazing, actually. Having you away from home in some
foreign country couldn't have been easy on her.
I agree. I believe it bothered her more than she let
on. And it most certainly tore me up inside as well.
As such, the two of us kept in touch through
a great many letters. We wrote each other
constantly, minutely detailing our daily lives.
It was through her encouragement, I believe, that
I was able to achieve all that I achieved, even
in a new land I knew nothing about.
And I wrote as much in a letter, advising my love
that I had made great strides and was to return to
her soon with the fruits of my labor in tow.
...But I never received a response from her.
Instead, a telegram was delivered to me from her
mother.
It was to inform me that my beloved...my Aya...
had passed away from complications with her
heart valve.
I had no idea she was suffering from a bad heart.
I couldn't have known, in fact, as she'd never once
said a word about it to me.
She'd suffered from this affliction for quite some
time, but hid the severity of it from me so as not
to stand in the way of my success.
Evidently, it was her greatest wish that I never
learn of her condition...
And I felt such shame that I couldn't be there for
her in her final moments. I wanted to deny my very
existence in recompense.
But she would not permit me to end my life
on her behalf.
In her dying breath, she told those around her,
'I want him to live out the years that I could not.'
...What's that?
A necklace I'd sent her from my new home overseas.
They say she never took it off even once after she
received it.
And I swore by this necklace that I would live on
and on for Aya. I would live enough for the both
of us!
But...I may have sworn a bit too hard.
As when I died, my spirit was unable to be
purified, and I wound up...well, here.
...*sob*...*sniffle*...
Wh-Why are you crying again?!
I... I never knew the bathroom ghost with the
terrifying voice could have such a sad backstory!
I-Is my voice really...terrifying? I'm very sorry.
I never intended to frighten anyone, but to correct
the impertinent behavior of those who open my door.
Hee hee. I know that now. I can't even imagine
being terrified of you anymore. You must have been
a really friendly person in life, Mr. Shimoda.
Is that...a compliment?
Of course!
...Hmmm. All right, then. I accept your kind words.
Oh, and just so you know, Mr. Shimoda...
When we left the bathroom, you shouted 'I love you!'
in English as you went back into your stall. But you
really shouldn't say that to just anyone.
Oh? And why not?
Because it literally means you LOVE the person
you're saying that to. It's a very strong thing
to say. Not at all appropriate for girls like us.
Hmm. Really, now?
If you just want to say you appreciate a person's
company or you're thankful to them for being so
nice, the word you want is 'like,' not 'love.'
I see. So... 'I LIKE YOU!!'
...Something like that?
Hee hee.
Rrg...
Ahahahaha! That still sounds really awkward.
Haha...
Hmph! I only said it because you told me to!
It's not polite to laugh at someone exhibiting
genuine effort.
But you laughed too, didn't you?
Never mind that. It's irrelevant.
What? That's not fair!
Pff... Well, you seem in much better spirits now.
No pun intended.
Oh... Haha. I guess I do feel a little better!
I was pretty down in the dumps there for a bit. Like
there wasn't a shred of hope left. But I think I'm
going to keep searching for Nari and Chihaya!
That's for the best, I believe. If you cling to
whatever hope remains and continue wandering these
halls, you may yet be able to change your fate.
All of us hold within us the ability to overcome
even the toughest of situations. We need only
believe in ourselves and maintain the struggle.
That's right!
Thank you for listening to my troubles, Mr. Shimoda.
And for telling me about yours. I'm going to go now,
but I hope you'll take care of yourself.
And I wish the same for you, Nana.
Fare thee well! I LIKE YOU!!
(Perhaps the wish we could never make good on is
within their power to keep.)
(I pray that they find one another...)
(Such kindly, compassionate young ladies as they
deserve some measure of happiness, even in this
place of misery. Luck be with you, Nana...)
(The boys' room again. Is that blue spirit still
here, I wonder?)
Hee...hee...heehee...hee...
Hee...heeheehee...heeheehee...hee...
...Hee...hee...heehee...hee...
...Hee...hee...heehee...hee...
The passage to the third floor is completely
blocked off.
